provides.name: files
provides.completeText: list files relative to current file, or start with /projectname

provides.name: mkdir
provides.preview: create a new directory, use a leading / to create a directory in a different project

provides.name: save
provides.completeText: add the filename to save as, or use the current file

provides.name: open
provides.preview: load up the contents of the file

provides.name: revert
provides.preview: revert the file to the last saved version

provides.name: status
provides.preview: get info on the current project and file

provides.name: newfile
provides.preview: create a new buffer for file
provides.completeText: optionally, you can specify a full path including project by starting the filename with '/'

provides.name: rm
provides.completeText: add the filename to remove, give a full path starting with '/' to delete from a different project. To delete a directory end the path in a '/'

provides.name: rescan
provides.preview: update the project catalog of files used by quick open

provides.name: timemachine
provides.preview: look at older versions of the current file
provides.completeText: No-arguments: display list of older versions, add revision to compare with a specific version

provides.name: export
provides.preview:
export the given project with an archivetype of zip or tgz
project export myproject
provides.completeText: project name, archivetype (zip | tgz, defaults to zip)

provides.name: import
provides.preview:
If a URL is given, import that URL (e.g. project import http://foo.com/bar.zip MyProject).

If only a project is given, then a file upload dialog will ask to upload a local file (e.g. project import MyProject).
provides.completeText:
import from a URL: project import http://foo.com/yourarchive.zip [projectname]

upload from your machine: project import YourProjectName

If only a URL is given, the projectname will be implied

If only a project name is given, a file upload window will be shown to upload.
provides.usage:
import from a URL: project import http://foo.com/yourarchive.zip [projectname]

upload from your machine: project import YourProjectName

If only a URL is given, the projectname will be implied

If only a project name is given, a file upload window will be shown to upload.
